column4: i need some help, ubuntu kinda died yesterday when i was doing a restart. i ran the recovery mode and it kept popping up things about a "drdy err", im on a livedisk on the same computer right now and  i cant mount the drive due to the daemon being inhibited
can't you even do something like "sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt"?
imagebin.org or imm.io
or imgur.com or ... well any image site
vibhav: http://imagebin.org/155605
Specify the mount-point explicitly, like sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt
not sure what you mean
You mount devices to some folder
That's called a "mount-point"
the syntax of the mount command is: mount DEVICE MOUNTPOINT
where do i put a mount point folder?
Typically it's just mnt. So run this: sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt
it says its mounted, now how do i get to it?
nautilus /mnt
would this allow me to restart and expect it to boot properly from the drive?
Doubt that.
how might i fix my drdy error then?
no idea.
You asked how to mount the drive, I said
how do i mount a drive thats invisible?
lolwut?
anddam: ive got an external drive that literally does not show up that worked fine the other day
